intro: Allantodia uraiensis, commonly known as the Uraiensis Allantodia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
